acf.editor:
Today's Fighter
#58: Bowser Jr.
When attacked, the Jr. Clown Car this little fella rides in takes less damage than Bowser Jr. himself – so try to stay in the car when taking damage. The different colour variations are the Koopalings!

Today's Stage
Wily Castle
Hazards from the previous games for both Nintendo 3DS and Wii U will appear on this stage. The Yellow Devil will cause a big explosion when it's defeated, but the player who landed the final attack doesn't take any damage. Use this to your advantage!

title.rendered: 070-Today's Music You can now listen to "Snake Eater".

acf.editor:
Today's Music
You can now listen to "Snake Eater". The original version was the opening theme song for Metal Gear Solid 3. This time it's an arrangement by Nobuko Toda!Music

Today's Stage
Moray Towers
This is a stage from the Splatoon and Splatoon 2 games. Look closely for Judd and Li'l Judd. Judd will raise the flag with the color of the fighter or team currently in the lead.

Today's Fighter
#19: Pichu
Pichu is back after 17 years! Pichu's electric attacks have greater range and do more damage than its other attack types – but they also damage Pichu.

Today's Fighter
#28: Pit
Pit is a well-balanced, well-rounded character with a defensive special that nullifies long distance attacks, and he has excellent recovery. And did we mention he rides a chariot of light in his Final Smash? He's a great choice for new players!

Today's Fighter
#46: Mega Man
Mega Man's standard and special moves use weapons copied from the bosses he's fought throughout the Mega Man series. That means he has more projectiles than any other fighter!

Today's Item
Pokémon: Alolan Raichu
He rides his tail and rushes the enemy. Since he moves freely around the stage, Alolan Raichu may be a bit difficult to dodge.

title.rendered: 062-Today's Music You can now listen to "Mega Man 4 Medley" on the official Super Smash Bros. Ultimate website.

acf.editor:
Today's Music
You can now listen to "Mega Man 4 Medley" on the official Super Smash Bros. Ultimate website.Music

Today's Fighter
#06: Kirby
Kirby's ability to copy other fighters is totally unique! While he is light and can be launched easily, he can also jump up to five times in the air, so he has great recovery. Look for his new Stone transformation, too.

Today's Fighter
#21: Marth
Marth is an exceptional swordfighter with a long reach. He'll do the most damage with attacks using the tip of his sword, so spacing is an important factor.

Today's Fighter
#33-35: Pokémon Trainer
Pokémon Trainer returns with Squirtle, Ivysaur and Charizard. You can choose to play as a male or female trainer!

Today's Item
Assist Trophy: Krystal
In addition to attacking with her staff, Krystal also uses Ice Blast to freeze fighters. Don't underestimate her!

Today's Fighter
#22: Young Link
He's back after 17 years! Young Link is faster than Link but he's also lighter, making him easier to launch.

Today's Stage
Kongo Falls
Face off against your foes atop a raft stuck at the edge of a waterfall. How well you utilise the rock jutting out at the bottom right can be the difference between victory or defeat!

Today's Music
You can now listen to "City Trial" on the official Super Smash Bros. Ultimate website.Music

Today's Fighter
#20: Falco
He's a talented aerial fighter with amazing jumping ability, but Falco is a bit slower on the ground. His Final Smash is an all-out attack using an unorthodox formation of Arwings!

title.rendered: 048 - Today's Item Assist Trophy: Knuckles the Echidna

acf.editor:
Today's Item
Assist Trophy: Knuckles the Echidna
Knuckles attacks nearby fighters with his fist. He can also dig into the ground and then attack with an uppercut, so be careful!

Today's Fighter
#38: Sonic the Hedgehog
This speedy fighter has a lot of rush-type attacks. His Final Smash, Super Sonic, lets him fly around the stage at an incredible speed!

Today's Fighter
#02: Donkey Kong
His charged punch is one of the strongest attacks in the game! In Super Smash Bros. Ultimate, his Final Smash has been updated from Konga Beat to a flurry of punches!

Today's Item
Pokémon: Lunala
This Pokémon shoots a powerful light beam through the stage!

Today's Item
Pokémon: Solgaleo
If this Pokémon hits you as it charges back and forth across the stage, you'll take serious damage!

Today's Item
Assist Trophy: Sukapon
Attacking with his detached fists and feet, Sukapon can even pick up opponents and throw them.

Today's Music
You can now listen to "Noisy Notebook" on the official Super Smash Bros. Ultimate website. Music

Today's Fighter
#31: Snake
Back by popular demand, Snake brings a ranged fighting style unlike any other fighter in the game. His Final Smash locks onto an opponent and fires five homing missiles.

Today's Fighter
#62: Corrin
Corrin was available as a downloadable fighter in the previous version of Super Smash Bros. This fighter uses all kinds of unique attacks, like Torrential Roar and Dragon Fang Shot. You can choose male or female versions!

Today's Fighter
#15: Ice Climbers
Back in the battle after a ten-year absence! There are two of them, so does that make them twice as strong as other fighters?

Today's Fighter
#03: Link
Link has been redesigned to match his appearance in The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild. Now he can pick up arrows he's fired, and his bombs have been upgraded to remote bombs, so you can set them off when the timing is just right!

Today's Item
Assist Trophy: Bomberman
Bomberman is a brand new Assist Trophy, which means he's here to help you during battle. The bombs he leaves on the stage detonate in his iconic, cross-shaped pattern!

Today's Music
You can now listen to "Bomb Rush Blush" on the official Super Smash Bros. Ultimate website. Music

Today's Item
Black Hole
Pulls fighters and items towards its powerful gravity field. If someone throws a Black Hole in your direction, you'd better keep your distance!

Today's Stage
Battlefield
This stage is sporting a redesigned look. With vast natural vistas forming a stunning backdrop behind floating platforms, this stage truly deserves its name!

Today's Fighter
#01: Mario
Mario is an all-around fighter who uses his wide variety of techniques to respond to any situation. In Super Smash Bros. Ultimate, he shows up in his Wedding tux and his Builder outfit, and even Cappy makes an appearance!

Today's Item
Pokémon: Alolan Vulpix
This Pokèmon freezes fighters with icy breath.

ZeRo from Chile has won the Super Smash Bros. Invitational 2018! A big thank you to all the players who participated! For those that missed the live stream, check out the replay. Nintendo at E3 2018 day 1

Today's Fighter
#13ᵋ: Daisy
Her basic move set is the same as Peach's, but this princess has her own unique personality. She's known for being upbeat, energetic, and a bit of a tomboy.

Today's Item
Launch Star
If you touch the star, your fighter will be launched at high speed. Clever placement can lead to an easy KO!

Today's Fighter
#65: Ridley
Joining the battle from the storied Metroid series, Ridley's long tail and sharp claws let him unleash a torrent of devastating attacks. His Final Smash is a powerful stream of plasma breath intense enough to bring down Samus' gunship.
The Nintendo booth at E3 2018 is jam-packed with fighters, weapons, items, and more from Super Smash Bros. Ultimate!

title.rendered: 014 - Today's Item Assist Trophy: Squid Sisters

acf.editor:
Today's Item
Assist Trophy: Squid Sisters
Cameras get closer and closer to their live performance, limiting the space you have to battle. Don't get too lost in the music!

Today's Fighter
#64: Inkling
Attacks with a variety of weapons. Covering opponents with ink leads to more and more damage – plus, these Inklings are really fashionable!
Mr. Sakurai made an appearance on Nintendo Treehouse Live!

If you have a Nintendo GameCube™ Controller Adapter, you can use the Nintendo GameCube Controllers you already have to play Super Smash Bros. Ultimate! In addition, new GameCube Controllers designed for Nintendo Switch will also be available when the game launches.
Good news: Super Smash Bros. series amiibo figures for new fighters Inkling and Ridley are on their way!

You can use all existing Super Smash Bros. Collection amiibo with Super Smash Bros. Ultimate! amiibo "figure players" can grow stronger the more you train them. You can even transfer your amiibo data from previous Smash Bros. titles.

Many talented musicians worked on the Super Smash Bros. Ultimate soundtrack, and you can hear some of their tracks on the official website. We'll be adding more music over the coming days.
Music
The official website for Super Smash Bros. Ultimate is live! The site is full of new information, so head over to see intro videos for each character, listen to the theme song, and more!
Check out this brand new video for the latest info on the Super Smash Bros. Ultimate game's fighters and gameplay.
A new fighter joins the battle! What waits at the end of the shadowy path?
These are the fighters joining the battle – ALL of them! The numbers indicate the order of their first appearance in the series.
Super Smash Bros. Ultimate for Nintendo Switch launches on 7/12!
